Home  Government   Mayor and Commissioners

Mayor and Commissioners

The City Commission consists of 5 members elected by the residents of the City of Breckenridge.

Under the council-manager form of government the Commission:

  • Adopts budgets
  • Appoints the city manager, who executes the laws and administers the government of the city
  • Determines policies
  • Enacts legislation
The City Commission meets once a month on the first Tuesday of each month at 5:30 pm in the City Commission Chambers located at 105 N. Rose, Breckenridge, Texas. Citizens are welcome to attend and can speak before the City Commission by attending the meeting, filling out a public comment form and turning it in to the City Secretary before the meeting starts. Please keep in mind that the Mayor and Commissioners are prohibited in responding to comments in the public forum due to Open Meetings state statutes.

Special meetings are held as needed. Check out our calendar to see all the meetings and events:


View the City Commission Calendar
